root.text:
Honda Civic Hybrid: 

Base price: $21,000 estimated; Engine: 1.3-liter, 85-h.p. gasoline and 13-h.p. electric motor ; Fuel economy: 48 m.p.g. city/48 highway. A gas/electric hybrid that doesn't look or act differently than gas only model. Very consumer friendly and a well recognized name, which should help gives hybrids consumer acceptance. With a combination of gas and electric, your driving range isn't limited because the batteries recharge as you drive, instead of stopping for a lengthy recharge as with battery-power only. Superb mileage and reduced emissions. Nice car to have regardless of whether gas is $1 or $2 a gallon. Paves way for even larger hybrids. Will environmentalists put money where mouth is? 

Mateja, Jim
Tribune News Service
October 11, 2002
